abstract: While the official government data aren’t in yet, a survey from Gallup indicates that consumer spending took a major hit in November, an economist writes.
snippet: While the official government data aren’t in yet, a survey from Gallup indicates that consumer spending took a major hit in November, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Alan B. Krueger is an economist at Princeton. Update | 5:24 p.m.  “If something cannot go on forever,” Herb Stein famously pronounced, “it will stop.” So it goes for the American consumer. Spending more money than one earns is feasible for only so long. Now the American consumer is tapped out.
